Class PurchaseRequest

extends TransactionRequest

    • Method Detail

      • getCashBackAmount

        public long getCashBackAmount()
        Returns:
        The cash back amount.

      • setCashBackAmount

        public void setCashBackAmount(long value)
        Parameters:
        value - The cash back amount. This amount must be included in totalAmount, and specified in the small units of the currency.

      • getMaximumTipAmount

        public long getMaximumTipAmount()
        Returns:
        The the maximum tip amount.
        Since:
        Version 1.7. Requires Westpay Payment Application 2.0.11, or later.

      • setMaximumTipAmount

        public void setMaximumTipAmount(long value)
        Parameters:
        value - The maximum tip amount allowed. If this value is set, it overrides the maximum percent. The value must be the tip amount only, it should not include the main amount of the transaction.

        If neither the maximum tip amount, nor the maximum tip percent, is set, then tipping is decided by how the payment application is configured.

        If both maximum tip amount, and the maximum tip percent, is set to 0, then tipping is disabled, regardless of how the payment application is configured.

        The maximum tip amount takes precedence over the maximum tip percent, so if both values are set, then the percent is ignored.

        Since:
        Version 1.7. Requires Westpay Payment Application 2.0.11, or later.

      • getMaximumTipPercent

        public int getMaximumTipPercent()
        Returns:
        The the maximum tip percent.
        Since:
        Version 1.7. Requires Westpay Payment Application 2.0.11, or later.

      • setMaximumTipPercent

        public void setMaximumTipPercent(int value)
        Parameters:
        value - The maximum tip amount allowed in percent of the main amount.

        If a specific maximum amount has been specified (setMaximumTipAmount(long)) then the maximum percent is ignored.

        If neither the maximum tip amount, nor the maximum tip percent, is set, then tipping is decided by how the payment application is configured.

        If both maximum tip amount, and the maximum tip percent, is set to 0, then tipping is disabled, regardless of how the payment application is configured.

        The maximum tip amount takes precedence over the maximum tip percent, so if both values are set, then the percent is ignored.

        Since:
        Version 1.7. Requires Westpay Payment Application 2.0.11, or later.

      • getAllowSkipTip

        public SkipTipOptions getAllowSkipTip()
        Returns:
        Determines if the customer is allowed to skip tipping, or not.
        Since:
        Version 1.7. Requires Westpay Payment Application 2.0.11, or later.

      • setAllowSkipTip

        public void setAllowSkipTip(SkipTipOptions value)
        Parameters:
        value - Determines if the customer is allowed to skip tipping, or not.
        Since:
        Version 1.7. Requires Westpay Payment Application 2.0.11, or later.

      • getTipAmount

        public long getTipAmount()
        Returns:
        The tip amount, in the small units of the current currency.
        Since:
        Version 1.7.

      • setTipAmount

        public void setTipAmount(long amount)
        Parameters:
        amount - A pre-determined tip amount, in the small units of the current currency.

        If this is non-zero, then the tipping dialogue will be skipped automatically.

        Since:
        Version 1.7. Requires Westpay Payment Application 2.0.11, or later.
